II. ALLEGATION(S)
Violation
Established?
On 5/08/21, staff member initiated a restraint which deviated from Yes
CPI. Staff member was making inappropriate comments during
the restraint. After restraint was de-escalated, staff member
continued to verbally respond to youth in an antagonistic way.
Staff members 8 and Staff 2 entered through the front door, the
restraint was in process; they stepped in between Youth A and
Staff 7, as the incident began to deescalate gradually. The hold
was said to have lasted five seconds or so. Staff 7 made
comments prior to initiating a restraint, including, "I killed people in
the army for 10 years." After the restraint concluded, Staff 7 did
keep space, as Youth A continued to pursue her with what
seemed like intent to assault, although she did also continue to
respond verbally in a way that could be interpreted as
antagonistic. It is unknown if Youth A had marks or bruises from
the incident. Youth A did have some bruising on his arm, however
he stated those were from last week. There were cameras in the
area the incident occurred. Staff 7 will be moved to a different
house so that she is not in contact with Youth A. Staff 7 has not
had any previous incidents related to this type of behavior in the
past.
Youth A was escalated and attempting to fight staff throughout the Yes
night. Youth A went up to Staff 3 and threatened to fight him. Staff
3 told Youth A to "go for it"; insisting Youth A would choose not to
do so. Youth A continued threatening Staff 3; however, did not
follow through on fighting him. After a couple minutes of this,
Youth A became assaultive with several staff. Youth A began
targeting Staff 3; however, did not swing at him. Staff 3 continued
antagonizing Youth A to fight him. Youth A eventually did start
becoming more physical with Staff 3; however, turned it towards
Staff 4. At this point, Staff 3 jumped in front of Youth A and began
pushing him away from the situation and lightly shoved Youth A to
the ground. This led to Youth A yelling and screaming and
becoming more physically aggressive with staff.
On 05/08/2021, staff member, Staff 2, threw Youth B on the No
ground during a restraint. Youth B did not receive any marks or
bruises. He was not complaining of any pain.

ALLEGATION 1:
235 SOUTH GRAND AVENUE  PO BOX 30037
 LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

On 05/08/2021, Staff 7 initiated a restraint, which deviated from CPI -- this restraint
was documented in a report filed with D.A. Blodgett St. John's. Staff 7 guided Youth
A's arms with her hands on his wrists down to his side and pushing him up on the
wall to create some space.
Staff members 8 and Staff 2 entered through the front door, the restraint was in
process; they stepped in between Youth A and Staff 7, as the incident began to
deescalate gradually. The hold was said to have lasted five seconds or so. Staff 7
made comments prior to initiating a restraint, including, "I killed people in the army
for 10 years." After the restraint concluded, Staff 7 did keep space, as Youth A
continued to pursue her with what seemed like intent to assault, although she did
also continue to respond verbally in a way that could be interpreted as antagonistic.
It is unknown if Youth A had marks or bruises from the incident. Youth A did have
some bruising on his arm, however he stated those were from last week. There
were cameras in the area the incident occurred. Staff 7 will be moved to a different
house so that she is not in contact with Youth A. Staff 7 has not had any previous
incidents related to this type of behavior in the past.
INVESTIGATION:
I interviewed Administrator 1 by phone on 5/10/21. She reported being aware of
the allegations and that she would provide the following information: video recording,
face sheets, treatment plans, safety plans, policy/procedures, and staff’s phone
numbers. She also reported that the two staff involved in the allegations have been
suspended until this investigation is completed. She reported that the facility has
requested a 30-day removal of Youth A because of his level of aggressive behaviors
and mental illness. She also reported that the facility is not able to meet the needs of
Youth A and that he needs a higher more secure setting for appropriate treatment.
I interviewed Staff 2 by phone on 5/10/21. He reported that Staff 7 and Staff 3
were in the house when Youth B stuck his head out of the open door and said, “you
bitch”. He also reported that he ran inside the house and observed Staff 7 placing
Youth A in an inappropriate hold. He reported that Staff 7 was facing Youth A and
had a hold of his wrists while his back was against the wall. He reported that she
should have used a “child-controlled hold or high-level hold” rather than what she
was using and given Youth A more space. He also reported that he and Staff 8 got
between Staff 7 and Youth A and initiated an appropriate hold while starting to
deescalate him. He reported that Staff 3 was trying to verbally deescalate Youth A
while also dealing with Youth B at the same time. He reported a belief that Staff 7
was not trying to harm Youth A but just trying to stop him from punching her. He
denied hearing what Staff 7 and Youth A were saying but remembers that they were
going back and forth about something. He reported that she was not being helpful
with the de-escalation of Youth A and later in the shift, he was told by Youth A that
Staff 7 said something about “killing people while being in the army for ten years”.
235 SOUTH GRAND AVENUE  PO BOX 30037
 LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov/mdhhs  517-373-3740

I interviewed Youth A in collaboration with the DHHS specialist by video
conference on 5/10/21. He reported not remembering being restrained by a female
staff. He reported being restrained by a male staff who left bruising on his arms but
was unable to identify when this occurred and by whom.
I interviewed Staff 7 in collaboration with the DHHS specialist by video
conference on 5/12/21. She reported that the incident began when Youth A failed to
follow directions and Youth B told Youth A to hit her. She also reported that he
started hitting her in the chest and he blocked her from leaving the area. She
reported grabbing his wrists and pinning them to his side as a way of keeping him
from hitting her. She also reported that once Staff 2 came into the house, she
released her hold and Youth A hit her again. She reported that she did not use the
correct technique to engage in a restraint, but she also reported that Staff 3 should
have restrained Youth A using the correct technique from behind. She reported
being trained to do a restraint from behind and that she was never taught how to
deal with a youth who was in her face. She reported telling Youth A that he would
not kill people after hearing Youth A say to his parent that he was going to kill
people. She also reported that she did say she has killed people while in the army
She reported making this statement as a way of “helping Resident A understand that
he would not follow through with harming others”. She reported that she has worked
at the facility for the past month, and this was her first restraint.
I interviewed Staff 8 by phone on 5/12/21. He reports coming into the house and
observing Staff 7 engaged with Youth A as described in the allegations. He gave a
similar report to Staff 2 with Staff 7 holding Youth A’s wrists. He reported, “it looked
like she was trying to stop him from hitting her” and also reported that her actions
were not a “CPI hold”. He reported not understanding why the other staff in the
home did not assist her.
I interviewed Staff 3 in collaboration with the DHHS specialist by Video
conference on 5/13/21. He reported being present during the allegations and that
he observed Staff 7 not using the appropriate de-escalation techniques with Youth
A. He also reported that Staff 7 appeared “aggressive” with both Youth A and Youth
B. He was asked about his position during the incident, and he reported that he was
trying to get Youth B out of the home. He also reported that he wanted to get Youth
B out of the home so Youth A would calm down and stop fighting Staff 7. He
reported “I didn’t see anything, but I know she was not using a proper restraint”.
Documents Reviewed:
I reviewed the document titled “Critical Incident/Adverse Event Report Form dated
5/8/21 @ 8:00 am and authored by Staff 2. The following was documented.
Youth A was restrained -- see RIR -- in the vicinity of 8 a.m. in Hunting House
milieu. The restraint, while brief, deviated from CPI and was stopped on sight.
It was later reported by both Youth A and Youth B that some of the
235 SOUTH GRAND AVENUE  PO BOX 30037
 LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov/mdhhs  517-373-3740

commentary from staff directed towards students may have been
inappropriate and potentially antagonistic.
I reviewed the video recording of the incident between Staff 7 and Youth A. The
video shows Staff 7 and Youth A face to face (almost touching) with Staff 7’s hands
on Youth A’s wrists. Staff 7 walks forward while Youth A is walking backwards
towards a wall. The video ends when they are just off camera view.
I reviewed the document tilted, “Restrictive Intervention Report” that was authored
by Staff 7. It is noted in this document that the intervention took place because
Youth A was a “Harm to others” and there was “imminent risk of serious physical
harm”. The following was noted on the document.
Staff 7 was followed by Youth A as he continued to verbally assault her,
making various threats; he encroached into her personal space and poke a
finger into her chest repeatedly, feigning punches with his other hand. Youth
A was encouraged to keep his space and to keep his hands to himself –
“Youth A: I’m not trying to hit you; please don’t hit me.”
As Staff 7 tried to head for the door to remove self from area, Youth A
continued to follow Staff 7 around the house until, using his fists as weapons,
he hit her in the breast; a restraint was initiated once he did in an effort to
keep all parties safe.
Staff 7, after being assaulted, went to block Youth A’s fists, which he still had
clenched and cocked back, guiding his right wrist down to his side with her
left hand and guiding his left hand down to his side with her right; it was a
reactive deviation from CPI. She held lightly at his wrists and the restraint
lasted no more than five or 10-seconds. This is when Staff 2 and Staff 8 re-
entered the house from outside, assessing the situation and stepping in
between Staff 7 and Youth A to create some space between them. The
restraint was released at this time.
I reviewed the personnel file of Staff 7. She was hired on 4/5/21 and completed all of
the required training for her orientation. This training included de-escalation and
behavior management techniques. There is no documentation of any disciplinary
action.
I reviewed Youth A’s current “Residential Updated Service Plan” dated 4/28/21. This
document outlines the treatment services provided to Youth A and the goals to
address the presenting problems. His progress and issues presented while at the
facility is also documented.
I reviewed the facility’s CPI restraint techniques. This document addresses several
types of physical intervention but stresses de-escalation as the primary technique.
There is no description of the type of hold that Staff 7 used as viewed on the video
235 SOUTH GRAND AVENUE  PO BOX 30037
 LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov/mdhhs  517-373-3740

recording and verbal descriptions from Staff 7 and other staff. There are several
descriptions of the appropriate way to handle a youth when face to face with the
youth. It is stated in this document, “avoid individual intervention when possible. Use
a team approach”.
APPLICABLE RULE
Rule 1 Prohibition of Prone Restraint; Procedures Involving Other
Restraints in Child Caring Institutions
(2) Resident restraint must be performed in a manner that is
safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity of the
minor child's behavior, chronological and developmental
age, size, gender, physical condition, medical condition,
psychiatric condition, and personal history, including any
history of trauma, and done in a manner consistent with the
resident's treatment plan.
ANALYSIS: Evidence provided through interviews, written documentation,
and video recording support the allegations of Staff 7 not
conducting the restraint in a safe manner as an approved
technique was not utilized. There is also evidence that Staff 3
did not support Staff 7 (hired one month ago) in her efforts to
deal with Youth A and he failed to engage in a “team approach”
as recommended in the CPI manual.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
ALLEGATION:
Youth A was escalated and attempting to fight staff throughout the night. Youth A
went up to Staff 3 and threatened to fight him. Staff 3 told Youth A to "go for it";
insisting Youth A would choose not to do so.
Youth A continued threatening Staff 3; however, did not follow through on fighting
him. After a couple minutes of this, Youth A became assaultive with several staff.
Youth A began targeting Staff 3; however, did not swing at him. Staff 3 continued
antagonizing Youth A to fight him. Youth A eventually did start becoming more
physical with Staff 3; however, turned it towards Staff 4. At this point, Staff 3 jumped
in front of Youth A and began pushing him away from the situation and lightly
shoved Youth A to the ground. This led to Youth A yelling and screaming and
becoming more physically aggressive with staff.
235 SOUTH GRAND AVENUE  PO BOX 30037
 LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov/mdhhs  517-373-3740

INVESTIGATION:
I interviewed Staff 1 by phone on 5/10/21. He reported working at the facility as a
“Youth Developmental Specialist” for the past two years. He reported the two-youth
wanted to fight staff and again ran outside. He reported going outside and hearing
Youth A screaming. He also reported observing Staff 3 talking with Youth A and
overhearing Staff 3 say “if you’re going to go let’s go”. He reported Youth B was
“sticking his head out of the door of the house and yelling for Youth A to hit Staff 3.
He also reported that Staff 3 will make this type of statement with Youth B but that
Staff 3 “has a very positive relationship with Youth B and Youth B will responded in a
positive way”. He reported that at this time, Staff 4 came into the situation and Youth
A began to move aggressively towards Staff 4. He reported that Youth A “swung on
Staff 4 and Staff 3 told him that he is not going to do that”. He reported that Staff 3
then “softly pushed Youth A away from Staff 4 and Youth A fell to the ground”. He
also reported Staff 3 was not aggressive towards Youth A but “Staff 3 should have
removed himself from the situation”. He reported that after telling Staff 3 to leave, he
left the area.
I interviewed Staff 2 by phone on 5/10/21. He reported getting to work around
10:30 to 11:00 pm when he observed Youth A and Youth B leave the house. He also
reported hearing what sounded like the youth assaulting staff outside so he went to
the location of the sound. He reported there were several staff present and all were
trying to deescalate the two youth. He gave a similar report as other staff about the
interaction between Staff 3 and Youth A and ended the interview when he reported
that Staff 3 put his arm out to get more space which caused Youth A to fall to the
ground. He also reported not observing any aggression by Staff 3.
I interviewed Youth A in collaboration with the DHHS specialist by video
conference on 5/10/21. He reported not remembering the allegations or falling to
the ground.
I interviewed Supervisor 2 by phone on 5/11/21. He reported being present during
the incident between Staff 3 and Youth A. He also reported that he was in the
basement of one of the homes when he heard noise from outside and went to
investigate. He reported observing Youth A and Youth B engaged in aggressive
behaviors towards Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3, and Staff 4. He also reported the youth
were trying to get to staff and attempted to punch staff. He reported Youth A
attempted to grab Staff 4 when Staff 3 began to make a barrier to keep him away.
He reported turning around at that time because of the actions of Youth B and when
he turned back around, Youth A was on the ground “screaming that Staff 3 had
pushed him down. He reported that the use of a staff’s arms as a barrier is
something they are taught and is appropriate as long as they don’t push with their
arms.
I interviewed Staff 6 by phone on 5/11/21. He reported not being present during
any of the incidents identified in the allegations. He also reported being on campus
235 SOUTH GRAND AVENUE  PO BOX 30037
 LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov/mdhhs  517-373-3740

during the second allegations but that he was in the house and didn’t go outside at
that time.
I interviewed Staff 5 by phone on 5/11/21. He reported being in the house doing
paperwork when he heard noise outside and rushed out. He gave the same report
as other staff about the aggression by Youth A and Youth B. He also reported the
same information about Staff 3’s reaction with the exception that “Staff 3 shoved
Youth A to the ground after Youth A attempted to hit Staff 4. He reported Staff 3
stood over Youth A and said “you need to calm down” before being told to leave the
area by the other staff. Staff 5 reported that Staff 3 was “very heated”.
I interviewed Staff 4 in collaboration with the DHHS specialist by phone on
5/13/21. She reported coming to the campus during her off time in an effort to be
“supportive of the other staff”. She reported observing Staff 3 and Staff 1 outside
with Youth A and Youth B, so she stopped to be a support. She reported that Staff 1
left the area so she “stepped between Youth A and Staff 3 because Youth A was
cursing and striking at Staff 3”. She also reported that after stepping between them,
Youth A shoved her and tried to choke her. She reported that Staff 3 then stepped
between them and “didn’t do anything extra”. She denied that Staff 3 put his hand
out and reported that “he kept his hand down at his side the whole time”.
I interviewed Staff 3 in collaboration with the DHHS specialist by video
conference on 5/13/21. He reported “blocking” a hit from Youth A on Staff 3. He
also reported, “Youth A was going to hit Staff 4 and I stepped in the way and he fell
backwards”. He reported that Youth A fell because they bumped into each other. He
reported that his arms and hands were at his sides throughout the incident and that
he placed his whole body between Staff 4 and Youth A when he was attempting to
block him from hitting her.
Documents Reviewed:
I reviewed the document titled “Behavior Management Policy”. The following is noted
in this document, “diversion and de-escalation techniques are the approaches staff
will respond with. Physical restraint will only be employed as a last resort”.
I reviewed Youth A’s safety plan. This document outlines staff’s response to different
behaviors that Youth A may present. Some of the responses that staff are to check
in with Youth A to determine his current level of emotional functioning and offer him
the chance to engage in activities that help calm him. It is also documented that
triggers that can cause dysregulation for Youth A.
I reviewed the document titled “Critical Incident/Adverse Event Report Form dated
5/8/21 @ 11:30 pm and authored by Staff 1. The following was documented.
Youth A was being assaultive with Staff 3 and was attempting to fight Staff 3.
Staff 4 intervened and attempted to create some space. Youth A stated that
235 SOUTH GRAND AVENUE  PO BOX 30037
 LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov/mdhhs  517-373-3740

when Staff 4 attempted to create space, she inadvertently got Youth A's left
thumb caught, causing Youth A to hurt his thumb. Once de-escalated, Youth
A allowed this writer to check on his thumb. This writer did not notice any
swelling or bruising and noticed a full range of motion with some pain. Ice and
pain meds were offered, but Youth A declined. When this writer checked in on
Youth A later and processed through the night, Youth A stated his thumb was
fine.
I reviewed the personnel file of Staff 3. Documentation indicates that he received all
of the required training including Trauma-Informed Care, De-escalating Hostile
Clients, and Best Practices: Behavior Support, and Intervention. There is no
documentation that he received any disciplinary action.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4157 Behavior management.
(1) An institution shall establish and follow written policies and
procedures that describe the institution’s behavior management
system. The policies and procedures shall be reviewed annually
and updated as needed. These shall be available to all
residents, their families, and referring agencies.
ANALYSIS: The facility is found in non-compliance as Staff 3 did not use an
appropriate method when attempting to deal with Youth A’s
behavior. His intervention resulted in Youth A falling to the
ground which is not a positive strategy in assisting Youth A to
make positive choices in his actions.
CONCLUSION: REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED

ALLEGATION 3:
On 05/08/2021, staff member, Staff 2, threw Youth B on the ground during a restraint.
Youth B did not receive any marks or bruises. He was not complaining of any pain.
INVESTIGATION:
I interviewed Supervisor 1 by phone on 5/11/21. He reported receiving the
allegations third hand on 5/10/21 at 11:30pm. He reported being informed of the
allegations by Staff 4 who informed him that Staff 3 told her he received the information
235 SOUTH GRAND AVENUE  PO BOX 30037
 LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov/mdhhs  517-373-3740

from Youth B. Supervisor 1 also reported being informed that Staff 4 was not present
during the incident. He reported telling Staff 4 to compete a report to centralized intake
about the situation she reported to him but reported that she left without doing so.
I interviewed Supervisor 2 by phone on 5/11/21. He reported remembering the
restraint but not being present at the time. He also reported talking to Youth B about the
restraint and having Youth B show him a bruise on his back yesterday which Youth B
told him occurred during the restraint. He reported being told by Staff 2 that during the
restraint he had to drop to his knee to reposition himself so he didn’t fall and that this
may have caused the bruise. He reported Staff 2 asked Youth B if he was hurt or
needed to see the nurse following the restraint and having Youth B deny any pain or
injury. He denied being informed of the allegations by either Staff 3 or Staff 4.
I interviewed Youth B in collaboration with the DHHS specialist by video
conference on 5/12/21. He reported he remembered the restraint by Staff 2 and gave
the following information. “He kneed my back and I have a bunch of marks. He didn’t do
it right and needs to be trained.” Youth B also reported that Staff 2 sat him on the
ground when he kneed him in the back. He reported that no one asked if he was alright
after the restraint.
I interviewed Staff 8 by phone on 5/12/21. He reported being present during the
restraint of Youth B by Staff 2. He also reported that Youth B told Youth A to attack Staff
2 after “Staff 2 told him that it was not cool to attack Staff 7”. He reported working with
Youth A to calm him down while Staff 2 began to attempt to deescalate Youth B. He
reported “Staff 2 used an appropriate child control hold” with Youth B after Youth B
refused to deescalate. He reported hearing Youth B say he couldn’t breathe so Staff 2
changed his position and asked Youth B if he was alright. He also reported Youth B
attempted to go to the ground but Staff 2 “got him into a more comfortable position”. He
reported at the end of the restraint, Staff 2 did ask Youth B if he had any injures or
issues and Youth B did not complain of any bruising or soreness. He also reported in
the past, Youth B would complain about any issues of soreness or pain.
I interviewed Staff 4 in collaboration with the DHHS specialist by phone on
5/13/21. She reported being informed about the allegations by Staff 3 and then telling
Supervisor 1 about the allegations. When asked about not making a report, she
reported believing that she didn’t have enough information and only secondhand
information. She also reported believing that Staff 3 had processed the situation with
Staff 2. When asked about not making a report after being told to do so by Supervisor 1,
She reported that she didn’t know how to make a report and that Supervisor 1 left so
she couldn’t ask him.
I interviewed Staff 3 in collaboration with the DHHS specialist by video
conference on 5/13/21. He reported that Youth B told him that his back was hurting
and that he had a bruise on his back from a restraint. He also reported observing the
bruise with Supervisor 2. He reported not making a report because “there was no
suspected abuse” and Youth B never said that “Staff 2, threw him to the ground”.
235 SOUTH GRAND AVENUE  PO BOX 30037
 LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov/mdhhs  517-373-3740

I interviewed Staff 2 in collaboration with the DHHS specialist by video
conference on 5/13/21. He reported checking with Youth B following the restraint and
Youth B didn’t report any issues of pain or injury. He also reported being told by
Supervisor 2 that he observed bruising on Youth B’s back later in the day and Youth B
reported the bruising to Supervisor 2 and his parents. He reported that this was the third
restraint of Youth B that day. He gave the same report that was written in the incident
and restraint reports. He reported having to reposition himself because Youth B was
“yelling rape”. He also reported that Youth B dropped his weight causing him to “go
down and I kept my knee in the same position”. He reported that he used a CPI
approved child hold during the restraint and once he released Youth B, Youth B began

ADDITIONAL FINDINGS:
During the course of the investigation with the third allegation, it was discovered that
Staff 4 reported the allegations to Supervisor 1 but failed to follow the
policy/procedure of making a report once having knowledge of suspected child
abuse.
INVESTIGATION:
I interviewed Supervisor 1 by phone on 5/11/21. He reported receiving the
allegations third hand on 5/10/21 at 11:30pm. He reported being informed of the
allegations by Staff 4 who informed him that Staff 3 told her he received the
information from Youth B. Supervisor 1 also reported being informed that Staff 4 was
not present during the incident. He reported telling Staff 4 to compete a report to
centralized intake but reported that she left without doing so.
I interviewed Youth B in collaboration with the DHHS specialist by video
conference on 5/12/21. He never reported that he was thrown to the ground. He
reported that he went to the ground.
I interviewed Staff 4 in collaboration with the DHHS specialist by phone on
5/13/21. She reported being informed about the allegations by Staff 3 and then
telling Supervisor 1 about the allegations. When asked about not making a report,
she reported believing that she didn’t have enough information and only secondhand
information. She also reported believing that Staff 3 had processed the situation with
Staff 2. When asked about not making a report after being told to do so by
Supervisor 1, she reported that she didn’t know how to make a report and that
Supervisor 1 left so she couldn’t ask him.
I interviewed Staff 3 in collaboration with the DHHS specialist by video
conference on 5/13/21. He reported that Youth B told him that his back was hurting
and that he had a bruise on his back from a restraint. He also reported observing the
bruise with Supervisor 2. He reported not making a report because “there was no
suspected abuse” and Youth B never said that “Staff 2, threw him to the ground”.
